TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit FBSession extends MonoTouch.Foundation.NSObject

summary.para: The object is used to authenticate a user and manage the user's session. After initializing a object the App ID and desired permissions are stored. Opening the session will initiate the authentication flow after which a valid user session should be available and subsequently cached. Closing the session can optionally clear the cache.

remarks.para: The object is used to authenticate a user and manage the user's session. After initializing a object the App ID and desired permissions are stored. Opening the session will initiate the authentication flow after which a valid user session should be available and subsequently cached. Closing the session can optionally clear the cache.
If an <FBRequest> request requires user authorization then an object should be used.
Instances of the class provide notification of state changes in the following ways:

item.description: Callers of certain FBSession methods may provide a block that will be called back in the course of state transitions for the session (e.g. login or session closed).
The object supports Key-Value Observing (KVO) for property changes.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

remarks.para: Creating a session
Returns a newly initialized session with default values for the parameters to <initWithAppID:permissions:urlSchemeSuffix:tokenCacheStrategy:>.

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string[] permissions) cil managed

param.name: permissions
param.para: An array of strings representing the permissions to request during the authentication flow. A value of nil indicates basic permissions. The default is nil.

summary.para: Returns a newly initialized session with the specified permissions and other default values for parameters to <initWithAppID:permissions:urlSchemeSuffix:tokenCacheStrategy:>.

remarks.para: Returns a newly initialized session with the specified permissions and other default values for parameters to <initWithAppID:permissions:urlSchemeSuffix:tokenCacheStrategy:>.

It is required that any single permission request request (including initial log in) represent read-only permissions or publish permissions only; not both. The permissions passed here should reflect this requirement.

remarks.para: Following are the descriptions of the arguments along with their defaults when ommitted.

It is required that any single permission request request (including initial log in) represent read-only permissions or publish permissions only; not both. The permissions passed here should reflect this requirement. If publish permissions are used, then the audience must also be specified.

summary.para: A helper method that is used to provide an implementation for [UIApplicationDelegate applicationDidBecomeActive:] to properly resolve session state for the Login flow, specifically to support app-switch login.

remarks.para: A helper method that is used to provide an implementation for [UIApplicationDelegate applicationDidBecomeActive:] to properly resolve session state for the Login flow, specifically to support app-switch login.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool HandleOpenURL(class MonoTouch.Foundation.NSUrl url) cil managed

summary.para: A helper method that is used to provide an implementation for [UIApplicationDelegate application:openURL:sourceApplication:annotation:]. It should be invoked during the Login flow and will update the session information based on the incoming URL.

remarks.para: A helper method that is used to provide an implementation for [UIApplicationDelegate application:openURL:sourceApplication:annotation:]. It should be invoked during the Login flow and will update the session information based on the incoming URL.

summary.para: Indicates whether the session is open and ready for use.

remarks.para: Indicates whether the session is open and ready for use.

summary.para: Specifies the login type used to authenticate the user.

remarks.para: Specifies the login type used to authenticate the user.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Open(class MonoTouch.FacebookConnect.FBSessionStateHandler handler) cil managed

param.name: handler
param.para: A block to call with the state changes. The default is nil.

remarks.para: Instance methods
Opens a session for the .

A session may not be used with <FBRequest> and other classes in the SDK until it is open. If, prior to calling open, the session is in the <FBSessionStateCreatedTokenLoaded> state, then no UX occurs, and the session becomes available for use. If the session is in the <FBSessionStateCreated> state, prior to calling open, then a call to open causes login UX to occur, either via the application or via mobile Safari.

Open may be called at most once and must be called after the is initialized. Open must be called before the session is closed. Calling an open method at an invalid time will result in an exception. The open session methods may be passed a block that will be called back when the session state changes. The block will be released when the session is closed.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Open (MonoTouch.FacebookConnect.FBSessionLoginBehavior behavior, MonoTouch.FacebookConnect.FBSessionStateHandler handler);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Open(valuetype MonoTouch.FacebookConnect.FBSessionLoginBehavior behavior, class MonoTouch.FacebookConnect.FBSessionStateHandler handler) cil managed

param.name: behavior
param.para: Controls whether to allow, force, or prohibit Login or Inline Login. The default is to allow Login, with fallback to Inline Login.

remarks.para: Logs a user on to .

A session may not be used with <FBRequest> and other classes in the SDK until it is open. If, prior to calling open, the session is in the <FBSessionStateCreatedTokenLoaded> state, then no UX occurs, and the session becomes available for use. If the session is in the <FBSessionStateCreated> state, prior to calling open, then a call to open causes login UX to occur, either via the application or via mobile Safari.

The method may be called at most once and must be called after the is initialized. It must be called before the session is closed. Calling the method at an invalid time will result in an exception. The open session methods may be passed a block that will be called back when the session state changes. The block will be released when the session is closed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig bool OpenActiveSession(bool allowLoginUI) cil managed

param.name: allowLoginUI
param.para: Sometimes it is useful to attempt to open a session, but only if no login UI will be required to accomplish the operation. For example, at application startup it may not be disirable to transition to login UI for the user, and yet an open session is desired so long as a cached token can be used to open the session. Passing NO to this argument, assures the method will not present UI to the user in order to open the session.

remarks.para: Class methods

This is the simplest method for opening a session with . Using sessionOpen logs on a user, and sets the static activeSession which becomes the default session object for any UI widgets used by the application. This session becomes the active session, whether open succeeds or fails.
Note, if there is not a cached token available, this method will present UI to the user in order to open the session via explicit login by the user.

Returns YES if the session was opened synchronously without presenting UI to the user. This occurs when there is a cached token available from a previous run of the application. If NO is returned, this indicates that the session was not immediately opened, via cache. However, if YES was passed as allowLoginUI, then it is possible that the user will login, and the session will become open asynchronously. The primary use for this return value is to switch-on facebook capabilities in your UX upon startup, in the case were the session is opened via cache.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool OpenActiveSession (string[] readPermissions, bool allowLoginUI, MonoTouch.FacebookConnect.FBSessionStateHandler completion);
.method public static hidebysig bool OpenActiveSession(string[] readPermissions, bool allowLoginUI, class MonoTouch.FacebookConnect.FBSessionStateHandler completion) cil managed

param.name: readPermissions
param.para: An array of strings representing the read permissions to request during the authentication flow. A value of nil indicates basic permissions. It is not allowed to pass publish permissions to this method.

summary.para: This is a simple method for opening a session with . Using sessionOpen logs on a user, and sets the static activeSession which becomes the default session object for any UI widgets used by the application. This session becomes the active session, whether open succeeds or fails.

remarks.para: This is a simple method for opening a session with . Using sessionOpen logs on a user, and sets the static activeSession which becomes the default session object for any UI widgets used by the application. This session becomes the active session, whether open succeeds or fails.

Returns true if the session was opened synchronously without presenting UI to the user. This occurs when there is a cached token available from a previous run of the application. If NO is returned, this indicates that the session was not immediately opened, via cache. However, if YES was passed as allowLoginUI, then it is possible that the user will login, and the session will become open asynchronously. The primary use for this return value is to switch-on facebook capabilities in your UX upon startup, in the case were the session is opened via cache.
